turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: You don't think so, huh?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Not really ... But you know... Maybe I'm wrong ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Otto called -

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: We do this. Then. You're finished. Then. You're clean

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: I like how you wallop back in here - after four years - and can still get all Clifford Huxtable on my shit ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: You hear me?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: I hear ya. Get me outta this. I'll move to the country. Open a fruit stand...

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: You spread it out ... you move around... So's they can't touch you... so's they don't know... Shadow games and shit ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: "Shadow games?"

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Shadow games ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: You spread it out, by the 2nd night, the heat are onto you. Know something's up. With a one-night boost, by the time all the cars are reported stolen, your ship's set sail.

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Reads the infrared. Then kills it. Little something the R & D department came up with ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: How long were you gonna let me try and stop it...?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: After a while, it became a little pathetic ... Figured I'd put you out of your misery ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Thank-you ...

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: De nada ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Ain't we good-timing here ... ?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: The family that steals together, deals together...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Dad'd be proud --

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Maybe not. But Dad was from another era...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: What era was that -- ?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: The era when crime didn't pay --

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: As opposed to now, Kid Car Crusher?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Price of doing business...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: What about just getting a job, 9 to 5, five days a week, that whole mystery achievement -- ?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: It's for assholes. The Legal Buck blows, Memphis.  You know that. Doing this, we make mad bank, my boys are down, the girlies come around and the boosts are a breeze. Yeah, sure, you're gonna get jacked-up every now and then - but ain't that a small price to pay for never, never-ever, having to say "paper or plastic?"

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Having fun, Kip?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Hell, yeah... It's a beautiful business ...  I mean, no, man, it's hard, it's scary, it sucks ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: You okay -- ?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: I'm cool.

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Too early to tell. Nervous?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Nah.

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: That's strange. I'm nervous. Donny's nervous. Everyone's nervous. But not you...

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: I dunno. Whatever will be will be...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: That's a good attitude, Kip. For everything but stealing cars ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: What did I tell you? What? What did I tell you?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: I don't know. What -- ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Come here --

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Come here -

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Come here -

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: I've missed you, man ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: I know. I've missed you, too

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Toby...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: I know ...

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Toby...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: I saw her get smashed-up on the TV. Knew there was no way he was gonna accept her ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Where'd you find this one?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Ya gotta keep tabs on your "Eleanors", Memphis. Cos you never know when you're gonna need one --

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: You boost her -- ?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Hell, yeah. She's not my unicorn.

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Move over ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: You okay -- ?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: I dunno ... I keep thinking about him.

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: You remember where you got this Eleanor -- ?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Sure, man --

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: She's for sale. They're asking forty thousand. Give 'em sixty ...

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: You want me to buy her?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Shocking, huh? We're clear now. It's done. I've never actually paid for a car. I want to see what it feels like

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Where you off to -- ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Thought I'd go for a ride -

turns.speaker: TUMBLER
turns.text: Thirteen down ... Thirty-seven to go ...

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: No problem -

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: But don't worry, man. Things are all sweetness and light here...

turns.speaker: TUMBLER
turns.text: Things are all leafy and suburban ...

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Pop the trunk, Tumbler.

turns.speaker: TUMBLER
turns.text: What for -- ?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: I gotta get my tool --

turns.speaker: TUMBLER
turns.text: Now what -- ?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Now, we go -

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Shit ...

turns.speaker: TUMBLER
turns.text: Run it...

turns.speaker: TUMBLER
turns.text: What are we gonna do -- ?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Hospital.

turns.speaker: TUMBLER
turns.text: We can't do that, dude --

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: He give you an advance -- ?

turns.speaker: MIRROR MAN
turns.text: Hell, yeah. Ten larger man

turns.speaker: MIRROR MAN
turns.text: You know of one -- ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Yeah. He's knows of one all right.

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Take it back, Freb --

turns.speaker: MIRROR MAN
turns.text: Hey, now, Memphis... C'mon, man -

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Okay. We're all here. Today's Wednesday. D-Day is Friday night ... That gives us two days to prep ... We're going to find the ladies on our list, find out where they live, when they're home; that they're properly insured ... Let's get into the vans --

turns.speaker: MIRROR MAN
turns.text: Where we going -- ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: We're going shopping -- !

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Jim Rockford. ROCKFORD FILES.

turns.speaker: MIRROR MAN
turns.text: For real?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: How's it going?

turns.speaker: MIRROR MAN
turns.text: It's going fine. The Quiet Riot and me are swapping trade secrets ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Call 911 -

turns.speaker: MIRROR MAN
turns.text: Call 'em here -- ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: DO IT! NOW -- !

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: See you're still stealing the sailors from the sea --

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: What's with the look?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: The hip, cool, sexy thing was getting old...

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: You look like you lost your sheep ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: You still wrenching at Bacchiochi's?

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: Hell, yeah. I'm not getting rich in here ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Buy you a drink?

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: Nope. I got a coffee. And a boyfriend.

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: "Mitch?"

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: Mitch.

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: So I was replaced by Mitch?

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: No. You were replaced by Alex. Who was replaced by Kevin. Who was replaced by Vince. Who was replaced by Mitch...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: On account of Mitch?

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: On account of me.

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: I've taken the spear for a lot of people, Sway. Including you. Can't we improvise a little here ... ?

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: No can do. Life goes on, pointfive ... You left me, remember?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: I left town. I didn't leave you.

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: A distinction worth noting ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: And here I am...

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: Yes. But I got a feeling it's not on account of any longing-for-my-touch on your part -

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Kip's in trouble

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: What kind of trouble -- ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Kip took a job. Fifty ladies in two weeks. Only the two weeks have turned into four days. And not a single lady has been snared.

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: And you got some Italians -- ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Six or seven...

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: I'm not doing it anymore. Haven't for a while. I've carved out something for myself. It's pathetic, but it's mine ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: I understand -

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: What the hell are you doing -- ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: If you change your mind. We're at Otto's. It's 50 ladies in 24 hours. For The Carpenter. 200 K and Kip's life on the felt. So long now ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: That's Mirror Man ... And that's Freb ... And Tumbler ... And Toby ... Fellas, this is Sara Wayland... They call her "Sway."

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: Hey -

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: What's wrong with her -- ?

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: The right side of the engine is running richer than the left. And the scope isn't showing shit... I dunno...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Right. Great car. One of a kind. I was looking forward to that boost myself

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: She was the only "Annie" you could find?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: They only made a handful. We're lucky there's even one living in the area...

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: Yeah, well ... She lives with District Court Judge Seymour Croft ...

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: She's trouble --

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: I put the boys on it. They're clever that way...

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: I go with you --

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: That what you want?

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: That's what I want ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: You mentioned that in your letters

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: I always thought you'd follow me up.

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: We were good when you bailed, weren't we?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Very good...

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: Cos there were those dark days, when I figured - my God, how easy it was for him to just give it up; to make the deal; take the rot for the whole crew ... And give me up in the process.

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: No way ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: No ...

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: Don't go getting all warm and fuzzy on me, Randall. I'm the jane that was left, and you're the jim that did the leaving. So save the sanctimonious shit for someone who believes. The only reason I ride with you, is cause I don't want to spend the whole night with any of them other creeps!

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Oh. Okay. Right.

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Ready -- ?

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: Oh, yeah.

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: No whistles, but a Club You bring a hack -- ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: No. Open her ...

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: What the hell's that -- ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: A little trick I picked up at the Car Thief Retirement Home ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Gosh, no. Lipstick? What next? Mascara, blush, floral-print dresses?

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: Deodorant.

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: So, you seeing anybody?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: No. I had a girl. She was great. The problem is: great girls come along once every ten years. So I gotta wait another three years before I can even bother to look...

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: She was so great, why'd you leave her?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Her parole officer strongly recommended it ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: C'mon, gang. Let's focus. Sway, can you prep 'em -- ?

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: I think so... They're just... So ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: I know. But let's prep 'em. We could stay here all night... That wouldn't be good --

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: Arright ... Enough ... I can't have you bellying up to my heart again, man, f you can't help falling off the stool. But he puts his mouth to her ears ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Shhh... Car thieves are your weakness.

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: Stop. What about Maserati Boy?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: I take out my slim-jim...

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: Oh, God...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Slip it in ...

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: You're going high-cheese, dude --

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Unlock your button ...

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: "Unlock my button" ... ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: The alarms go off ...

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: Woo-woo-wooooo!

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: I pop your hood; find your siren wires

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: They're factory alarms ... Easy to get around... For a man with... Skills...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: I do ... I cut "em...

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: Cut 'em...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Now... I'm in ...

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: Of course you are. You're a professional...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: I ratchet your ignition mechanism ...

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: I bet you say that to all the girls...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: With a twist of my wrist ... You're turned over ...

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: Wrong preposition...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Hear you roar ...

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: What about The Club ... ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Let me worry about The Club ...

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: No worries ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: I've got you floored... We're off ... Take the curb... Man, can you corner... Know not to get on it ... Momentum shift ... Don't get on those brakes too hard ... Get her up on her tires. Up on her toes. Up ... Up... Up.

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: You're still quite the boost, Randall Raines ...  Except now I've been chopped, and my parts are in a Honda Prelude being driven to church in South America by some Bolivian consulate's wife ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: And Tracy's on the move ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Donny got shot ... A jacker ...

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: How is he -- ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: They got him to the hospital. He's stable ...

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: Where to -- ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Kip's not clear yet. We got one more to go --

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: You okay -- ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Yeah ... You -- ?

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: What are you doing... ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Seeing if you wanted to go for a ride?

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: I can't. I got a back load of repairs and one of the mechanics called in sick and I haven't slept and--  Where to -- ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: I dunno. I know a place.

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: This time it's for real?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Oh, yeah. For real, point-five.

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: What -- ?

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: Nothing. Just that if I was less secure, I might think you were more into Eleanor than you are me...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: She does have one thing you don't.

turns.speaker: SWAY
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Bench seats.

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: Am I dying? Are all the angels of my life returning to bid a final farewell?  And have my angels completely lost their fashion sense -- ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Hello, Otto ...

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: You remember Junie?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Of course. Hi, Junie --

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: Whatever do you mean?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: The chop-shop... Where are the stripped cars?  The rolled-back odometers? The part bins?

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: What happened? Old-age happened. I tired of killing them. I woke up one morning and thought I am no longer a destroyer. I am a means of resurrection. Now. We restore. We revive. There are so few things in this life, we can prevent from decay. Most must die. These don't have to...

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: I heard rumors you were back. About Kip ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: He's gotten involved --

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: You think it can be done?

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: Are you considering a comeback tour?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Tell me...

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: It can be done. Take two days to shop; one to prep. I'll offer up my bible for a small fee. You also have to hope Kip's jerk-circus didn't undo Castlebeck's linkage so much so that he's setting up surveillance teams on every city block. And then get yourself a crew...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: The hard part ...

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: "A people is a detour of nature to get 6 or 7 great men - Yes, and then to get around them..." Nietzsche said that.

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Is he still working here ?

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: The old crew. Go find them. I can't help you with that. Since I've cleaned up the act a bit, they no longer come around... A pity how legitimacy makes you unpopular -

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: I Just don't know how happy they'll be to see me

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: I remember I had a 1964 Buick Opal. worst car ever built. Value job. Everything broke and I-fixed it. A coma car - built to German specs. Plastic gas line. 3 speedometer head. On a quiet night, you could hear it rusting in the garage. But when that car was gone, I missed it. If it came driving back in here right now, there'd be tears and laughter ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: And the moral of that story is -- ?

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: Go to them. They'll be happy to see you ... Ahhh...

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: Some crew you got ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: If we put out the word. That we're crewing-up, for a one-time-only job... What do you think that'll yield?

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: You need him...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: No we don't -

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: I appreciate your dilemma, Memphis. But how are two washed-up thieves and an old man supposed to boost 50 cars in three days...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: His criminal career has officially come to a close ...

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: The conundrum still applies, of course. The purpose of the endeavor is to rescue baby brother from imminent death and/or a life of crime. However. This cannot be successfully carried out without baby brother's considerable resources, shabby though they may be.

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Okay, then... Otto?

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: In order to succeed, you're going to have to go old-school. one night boost. Put all your nuts in one basket. And...

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: Anyone? The significance of "Robin 1" on Magnum's license plate? Memphis?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Robin was Robin Masters. He owned the estate they lived on ...

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: Ten points for our fearless leader ... Sway, how 'bout giving us the honor of the Bill Bixby trifecta -- ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Split it up. Any word on Donny?

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: He's gonna be okay. Could do a bit.

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: What happened to Sway?

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: She left...

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: Dinosaurs. All of us. The Ice Age is now...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: I'll see you soon --

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Hey, Memphis. Remember me? Toby Walker. I live next door ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Sure. Hey, Toby. You grew up

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Yeah, I'm cool ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: How old are you now, Toby?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Sixteen. But my birthday's in seven months ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: This Eleanor's been living at the International Towers for 3 years now.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Who's "Eleanor?"

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: The 167 Mustang Shelby Mustang GT-500.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Why do you call it "Eleanor?"

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: All the vehicles get code names. Female names. You say "Eleanor lives at such and such... " and no one listening on the waves is the wiser ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: She's not. Carroll Shelby tweaked the Mustang's High-Performance 289 engine and got it legally rated for the street at 450 horsepower ... But its actual output is closer to 600 ...

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: So she flies -

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: She soars -

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: I logged outside the G.R.A.B. site, right? Then I monitored their incoming outside data requests, right? Then I got these ISDN numbers, right? Then I tracked them back, right? Then I took the one I could jack-up the easiest, right? Then I called back see, they think I'm an insurance company - that's where it looks like I'm coming from -- and they're sharing stats with this insurance company, right? So now they're sharing it with me, right? They think I'm looking for stats for an actuarial conference on auto-theft. So they let me in, right? Give me all these numbers. But then I don't leave, right? I'm in. I've got the key. Now I just go anywhere I want.

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: So what's in there -- ?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: I can tell you who's gonna be on duty tonight. I can tell you how much gas they're using monthly. I can tell you how they used to spend that annoying half-hour between "FRIENDS" and "SEINFELD"...

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: What about me?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: You'll be at the docks ... Keeping Otto abreast of our progress ...

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: How come ... ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Because you should be home with Nintendo, listening to The Spice Girls, little man ...

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Come on. Kip, talk to the guy

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Okay. All our ladies should be home now, tucked in bed. Let's keep chilly. Think Slow. Any questions?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: You sure I can't go with ya?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: You're gonna be okay, Toby... You are ... We'll getcha fixed up...

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: No ... No... No ... Tell me what's gonna happen? Kip? Tell me. What's gonna happen?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: You know what you got here?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Not really -

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: There's excessive resistance in the cranking circuit ... You know what you gotta do -- ?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Not really --

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: You have any other answers besides "not really"?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Not --

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Right. You want to test the voltage drop ... Use the voltmeter ... Remove the primary lead from the ignitioncoil and crank her ... See what you got ... You understand -- ?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Uh ... Randall -- ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Excuse me --

turns.speaker: TUMBLER
turns.text: What do you want, shithead?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Why you gotta front me like that? I'm talking to Kip --

turns.speaker: TUMBLER
turns.text: Why don't you leave him alone?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: I known Kip longing than you, man ...

turns.speaker: TUMBLER
turns.text: Oooh, ain't you the lucky duck --

turns.speaker: TUMBLER
turns.text: What are you doing here, assface?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Checkin' it out

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Which way's out, man -- ?

turns.speaker: TUMBLER
turns.text: Shit all looks the same here --

turns.speaker: ANGIE
turns.text: You think I don't know? You think I like to keep this inside? But I gotta, or he'll kill the miserable bastard and he'll be there for life. It's disgusting what you have to put up with.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Look at Jeannie's kid.

turns.speaker: ANGIE
turns.text: What? What happened?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: The oldest one.  He was in an argument. A lousy ten-dollar card game. The kid pulls out a gun. It goes off. The kid gets killed. The grandmother hears it and finds out he's been arrested. She has a heart attack.  She drops dead right on the spot. Now Jeannie's got a husband and son in jail and a mother in the funeral parlor.

turns.speaker: ANGIE
turns.text: But he was always a bad kid, that one.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: No. Come on. It was the younger one that was the bad one.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Hey, look at him. Tommy. You grew up.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Billy, how are you?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Son of a bitch. Get over here.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Hey, Billy. Watch the suit.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Listen to him.  "Watch the suit," he says.  A little pisser I've known all my life.  Hey, Tommy, don't go get too big.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Don't go busting my balls. Okay?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Busting his balls?  If I was busting your balls, I'd send you home for your shine box.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: You remember Tommy's shines? The kid was great.  He made mirrors.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: No more shines, Billy.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Come ooonnn. Tommeeee. We're only kidding. You can't take a joke? Come ooonn.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Tell him. It's okay.

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: What did you hear about that thing?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What thing? The Brooklyn thing?

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: No. No. The guy from downtown.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: The guy from near where Christie used to live?

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: No. The other one. The one who disappeared up the block from Christie. The one they made a beef on.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Oh I Him.

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: I don't want any more of that Shit.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Wha?  Me?

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: Just stay away from the garbage. Yon know what I mean.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Me? Why would I get into that shit?

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: I know what you did inside. You did what you had to do. I'm not talking about that.  I'm talking from now on, outside. I'm talking right here.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Why would I get into that?

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: I'm not going to get fucked like Gribbs. He's seventy years old and the fucking guy is going to die in prison.  I don't need that. I don't care who it is. I'm warning everybody. Gribbs got twenty years just because he said hello to some fuck who was sneaking around selling junk behind his back. That's not going to happen to me.  You understand?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Paulie. Why would I? I swear.

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: You're only home early because we got you a job, right? And I don't need any heat. You understand?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Nods.

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: And, if you hear about anybody else fucking around with that shit, you tell me.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Nods again.

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: Anybody!  You understand?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: I warned you a million times.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I've been all fucked up since I got out.

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: You think I didn't know what you were doing?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: It was easy money. I did it in the can.  Shit! I learned the junk business in the can, Paulie.

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: Right in my face. You looked in my face and you lied.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: But, Paulie, I'm sorry. Believe me.  I was fucking crazy.  But I'm okay now. I can be trusted.  I'm clean now. On my children. Believe me! Two weeks cold turkey waiting for bail got my head together...

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: You thought I was some fucking jerk?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Paulie, I couldn't come to you. I didn't want to put you in this shit.  I was ashamed to come to you. I knew I was wrong.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Paulie.  You're all I got.  I need help.

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: You treated me like shit.

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: Here. Take it.  Now I gotta turn my back on you.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Thirty-two hundred bucks. That's what he gave me. Thirty-two hundred bucks for a lifetime. It wouldn't have paid for the coffin.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I had a meeting with Tuddy around eleven o'clock and here I am a back-up guy.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Have more coffee.  It'll wake you up.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I couldn't wait to get away. I was ordering the dessert when they were eating dinner. When they were having coffee, I was asking for a check.
